667.quote: What we fear doing most is usually what we most need to do.
667.author: Tim Ferriss

668.quote: The body does not want you to do this. As you run, it tells you to stop but the mind must be strong. You always go too far for your body. You must handle the pain with strategy...It is not age; it is not diet. It is the will to succeed.
668.author: Jacqueline Gareau

669.quote: The way to get things done is not to mind who gets the credit for doing them.
669.author: Benjamin Jowett

670.quote: What sunshine is to flowers, smiles are to humanity. These are but trifles, to be sure; but scattered along life's pathway, the good they do is inconceivable.
670.author: Joseph Addison

671.quote: You cannot change your destination overnight, but you can change your direction overnight.
671.author: Jim Rohn

672.quote: Success is the sum of small efforts, repeated day-in and day-out.
672.author: Robert Collier

673.quote: You will never 'find' time for anything. If you want time, you must make it.
673.author: Charles Buxton

674.quote: You have succeeded in life when all you really want is only what you really need.
674.author: Vernon Howard

675.quote: The harder you work, the harder it is to surrender.
675.author: Vince Lombardi

676.quote: If you realized how powerful your thoughts are, you would never think a negative thought.
676.author: Peace Pilgrim

677.quote: Winning is great, sure, but if you are really going to do something in life, the secret is learning how to lose.
677.author: Wilma Rudolph

678.quote: You must take personal responsibility. You cannot change the circumstances, the seasons, or the wind, but you can change yourself. That is something you have charge of.
678.author: Jim Rohn

679.quote: If you only read the books that everyone else is reading, you can only think what everyone else is thinking.
679.author: Haruki Murakami

680.quote: In all human affairs there are efforts, and there are results, and the strength of the effort is the measure of the result.
680.author: James Allen

681.quote: It is so hard to leave—until you leave. And then it is the easiest goddamned thing in the world.
681.author: John Green

682.quote: People who boast about their I.Q. are losers.
682.author: Stephen Hawking

683.quote: Miss a meal if you have to, but don't miss a book.
683.author: Jim Rohn

684.quote: To understand the heart and mind of a person, look not at what he has already achieved, but at what he aspires to.
684.author: Khalil Gibran

685.quote: It is better to be alone than in bad company.
685.author: Unknown

686.quote: Not everything that is faced can be changed. But nothing can be changed until it is faced.
686.author: James A. Baldwin

687.quote: Try to learn something about everything and everything about something.
687.author: Thomas Huxley

688.quote: You don't fight racism with racism, the best way to fight racism is with solidarity.
688.author: Bobby Seale

689.quote: Help others achieve their dreams and you will achieve yours.
689.author: Les Brown

690.quote: Effort and courage are not enough without purpose and direction.
690.author: John F. Kennedy

691.quote: One doesn't discover new lands without consenting to lose sight, for a very long time, of the shore.
691.author: Andre Gide

692.quote: All things are difficult before they are easy.
692.author: Thomas Fuller

693.quote: We are what we pretend to be, so we must be careful what we pretend to be.
693.author: Kurt Vonnegut

694.quote: People ask the difference between a leader and a boss. The leader leads, and the boss drives.
694.author: Theodore Roosevelt

695.quote: The thing that is really hard, and really amazing, is giving up on being perfect and beginning the work of becoming yourself.
695.author: Anna Quindlen

696.quote: Love is the ability and willingness to allow those that you care for to be what they choose for themselves without any insistence that they satisfy you.
696.author: Wayne Dyer

697.quote: Sooner or later, those who win are those who think they can.
697.author: Paul Tournier

698.quote: Those who matter don't mind, and those who mind don't matter.
698.author: Bernard Baruch

699.quote: You were born to win, but to be a winner, you must plan to win, prepare to win, and expect to win.
699.author: Zig Ziglar

700.quote: Everyone seems to have a clear idea of how other people should lead their lives, but none about his or her own.
700.author: Paulo Coelho

701.quote: If you don't like something, change it. If you can't change it, change your attitude.
701.author: Maya Angelou

702.quote: Gratitude unlocks the fullness of life. It turns what we have into enough, and more. It turns denial into acceptance, chaos to order, confusion to clarity. It can turn a meal into a feast, a house into a home, a stranger into a friend.
702.author: Melody Beattie

703.quote: A hero is someone who has given his or her life to something bigger than oneself.
703.author: Joseph Campbell

704.quote: I don't go by the rule book... I lead from the heart, not the head.
704.author: Princess Diana

705.quote: Man never made any material as resilient as the human spirit.
705.author: Bernard Williams

706.quote: The more one judges, the less one loves.
706.author: Honore de Balzac

707.quote: The best way to find out if you can trust somebody is to trust them.
707.author: Ernest Hemingway

708.quote: At the end of the day, all you can hope for is to go on. The older I get, the more I realize that just keeping on keeping on is what life's all about.
708.author: Janis Ian

709.quote: I cannot always control what goes on outside. But I can always control what goes on inside.
709.author: Wayne Dyer

710.quote: Expect trouble as an inevitable part of life and when it comes, hold your head high, look it squarely in the eye and say “I will be bigger than you. You cannot defeat me.” Then repeat to yourself the most comforting of all words , “This too shall pass.”
710.author: Ann Landers

711.quote: I have witnessed the softening of the hardest of hearts by a simple smile.
711.author: Goldie Hawn

712.quote: When you judge another, you do not define them, you define yourself.
712.author: Wayne Dyer

713.quote: The only way to live is to accept each minute as an unrepeatable miracle, which is exactly what it is: a miracle and unrepeatable.
713.author: Storm Jameson

714.quote: We are all here for some special reason. Stop being a prisoner of your past. Become the architect of your future.
714.author: Robin Sharma

715.quote: When I do good, I feel good. When I do bad, I feel bad. That's my religion.
715.author: Abraham Lincoln

716.quote: The best way out is always through.
716.author: Robert Frost

717.quote: I don't know what the future may hold, but I know who holds the future.
717.author: Ralph Abernathy

718.quote: People become really quite remarkable when they start thinking that they can do things. When they believe in themselves they have the first secret of success.
718.author: Norman Vincent Peale

719.quote: The elevator to success is out of order. You'll have to use the stairs... one step at a time.
719.author: Joe Girard

720.quote: Always walk through life as if you have something new to learn, and you will.
720.author: Vernon Howard

721.quote: He who is not everyday conquering some fear has not learned the secret of life.
721.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

722.quote: True terror is to wake up one morning and discover that your high school class is running the country.
722.author: Kurt Vonnegut

723.quote: Every time you don't follow your inner guidance, you feel a loss of energy, loss of power, a sense of spiritual deadness.
723.author: Shakti Gawain

724.quote: Believe in love. Believe in magic. Hell, believe in Santa Clause. Believe in others. Believe in yourself. Believe in your dreams. If you don't, who will?
724.author: Jon Bon Jovi

726.quote: Silence is the sleep that nourishes wisdom.
726.author: Francis Bacon

727.quote: Maxim for life: You get treated in life the way you teach people to treat you.
727.author: Wayne Dyer

728.quote: Stay committed to your decisions, but stay flexible in your approach.
728.author: Tony Robbins

729.quote: You can tell whether a man is clever by his answers. You can tell whether a man is wise by his questions.
729.author: Naguib Mahfouz

730.quote: Develop success from failures. Discouragement and failure are two of the surest stepping stones to success.
730.author: Dale Carnegie

731.quote: If one advances confidently in the direction of his dreams, and endeavors to live the life which he has imagined, he will meet with a success unexpected in common hours.
731.author: Henry David Thoreau

732.quote: The very purpose of Christ's coming into the world was that He might offer up His life as a sacrifice for the sins of men.  He came to die.  This is the heart of Christmas.
732.author: Billy Graham

733.quote: You have to grow from the inside out. None can teach you, none can make you spiritual. There is no other teacher but your own soul.
733.author: Swami Vivekananda

734.quote: God has given us two hands, one to receive with and the other to give with.
734.author: Billy Graham

735.quote: You can close your eyes to the things you don't want to see, but you can't close your heart to the things you don't want to feel.
735.author: Johnny Depp

736.quote: The most common way people give up their power is by thinking they don't have any.
736.author: Alice Walker

737.quote: If you can believe it, the mind can achieve it.
737.author: Ronnie Lott

738.quote: If Tyranny and Oppression come to this land, it will be in the guise of fighting a foreign enemy.
738.author: James Madison

739.quote: I do believe we're all connected. I do believe in positive energy. I do believe in the power of prayer. I do believe in putting good out into the world. And I believe in taking care of each other.
739.author: Harvey Fierstein

740.quote: What we think or what we know or what we believe is in the end of little consequence. The only thing of consequence is what we do
740.author: John Ruskin

741.quote: Never dull your shine for somebody else.
741.author: Tyra Banks

742.quote: It can not be emphasized too strongly or too often that this great nation was founded, not by religionists, but by Christians, not on religions, but on the gospel of Jesus Christ!
742.author: Unknown

743.quote: To give thanks in solitude is enough. Thanksgiving has wings and goes where it must go. Your prayer knows much more about it than you do.
743.author: Victor Hugo

744.quote: Don't compare your life to others. You have no idea what they have been through.
744.author: Sam Cawthorn

745.quote: The minute I heard my first love story, I started looking for you.
745.author: Rumi

746.quote: Knowledge is of no value unless you put it into practice.
746.author: Anton Chekhov

747.quote: Faith is the strength by which a shattered world shall emerge into the light.
747.author: Helen Keller

748.quote: If you are losing faith in human nature, go out and watch a marathon.
748.author: Kathrine Switzer

749.quote: The tree of liberty must be refreshed from time to time with the blood of patriots and tyrants.
749.author: Thomas Jefferson

750.quote: I've read the last page of the Bible. It's all going to turn out all right.
750.author: Billy Graham

751.quote: From what we get, we can make a living; what we give, however, makes a life.
751.author: Arthur Ashe

752.quote: Just because Fate doesn't deal you the right cards, it doesn't mean you should give up. It just means you have to play the cards you get to their maximum potential.
752.author: Les Brown

753.quote: Don't you ever let a soul in the world tell you that you can't be exactly who you are.
753.author: Lady Gaga

754.quote: We must overcome the notion that we must be regular... it robs you of the chance to be extraordinary and leads you to the mediocre.
754.author: Uta Hagen

755.quote: Exercise is king. Nutrition is queen. Put them together and you've got a kingdom.
755.author: Jack LaLanne

756.quote: You have not lived today until you have done something for someone who can never repay you.
756.author: John Bunyan

757.quote: All the great things are simple, and many can be expressed in a single word: freedom, justice, honor, duty, mercy, hope.
757.author: Winston Churchill

758.quote: Talent is cheaper than table salt. What separates the talented individual from the successful one is a lot of hard work.
758.author: Stephen King

759.quote: Watch your manner of speech if you wish to develop a peaceful state of mind. Start each day by affirming peaceful, contented and happy attitudes and your days will tend to be pleasant and successful.
759.author: Norman Vincent Peale

760.quote: When a person really desires something, all the universe conspires to help that person to realize his dream.
760.author: Paulo Coelho

761.quote: The brighter you are, the more you have to learn.
761.author: Don Herold

762.quote: When you dance, your purpose is not to get to a certain place on the floor. It's to enjoy each step along the way.
762.author: Wayne Dyer

763.quote: Most people ask for happiness on condition. Happiness can only be felt if you don't set any condition.
763.author: Arthur Rubinstein

764.quote: The person born with a talent they are meant to use will find their greatest happiness in using it.
764.author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

765.quote: Nothing is so permanent as a temporary government program.
765.author: Milton Friedman

766.quote: Today, more than ever before, life must be characterized by a sense of Universal responsibility, not only nation to nation and human to human, but also human to other forms of life.
766.author: Dalai Lama

767.quote: Effort only fully releases its reward after a person refuses to quit.
767.author: Napoleon Hill

768.quote: You're never as good as everyone tells you when you win, and you're never as bad as they say when you lose.
768.author: Lou Holtz

769.quote: I do not think much of a man who is not wiser today than he was yesterday.
769.author: Abraham Lincoln

770.quote: Humor is by far the most significant activity of the human brain.
770.author: Edward de Bono

771.quote: We should certainly count our blessings, but we should also make our blessings count.
771.author: Neal A. Maxwell

772.quote: As the family goes, so goes the nation and so goes the whole world in which we live.
772.author: Pope John Paul II

773.quote: Everyone has inside of him a piece of good news. The good news is that you don't know how great you can be! How much you can love! What you can accomplish! And what your potential is!
773.author: Anne Frank

774.quote: When you arise in the morning, think of what a precious privilege it is to be alive - to breathe, to think, to enjoy, to love.
774.author: Marcus Aurelius

775.quote: Act as if what you do makes a difference. It does.
775.author: William James

776.quote: When you are offended at any man's fault, turn to yourself and study your own failings. Then you will forget your anger.
776.author: Epictetus

777.quote: I have never met a man so ignorant that I couldn't learn something from him.
777.author: Galileo Galilei

778.quote: The supreme art of war is to subdue the enemy without fighting.
778.author: Sun Tzu

779.quote: If everyone is thinking alike, then somebody isn't thinking.
779.author: George S. Patton

780.quote: A nation can survive its fools, and even the ambitious. But it cannot survive treason from within. An enemy at the gates is less formidable, for he is known and carries his banner openly. But the traitor moves amongst those within the gate freely, his sly whispers rustling through all the alleys, heard in the very halls of government itself.
780.author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

781.quote: It is foolish and wrong to mourn the men who died. Rather we should thank God that such men lived.
781.author: George S. Patton

782.quote: An invincible determination can accomplish almost anything and in this lies the great distinction between great men and little men.
782.author: Thomas Fuller

783.quote: The quality of a leader is reflected in the standards they set for themselves.
783.author: Ray Kroc

784.quote: Can anything be sadder than work left unfinished? Yes, work never begun.
784.author: Christina Rossetti

785.quote: Don't just read the easy stuff. You may be entertained by it, but you will never grow from it.
785.author: Jim Rohn

786.quote: And by the way, everything in life is writable about if you have the outgoing guts to do it, and the imagination to improvise. The worst enemy to creativity is self-doubt.
786.author: Sylvia Plath

787.quote: You've got to get to the stage in life where going for it is more important than winning or losing.
787.author: Arthur Ashe

788.quote: One of the hardest things in life is having words in your heart that you can't utter.
788.author: James Earl Jones

789.quote: Success is not to be pursued; it is to be attracted by the person you become.
789.author: Jim Rohn

790.quote: You can't separate peace from freedom because no one can be at peace unless he has his freedom.
790.author: Malcolm X

791.quote: Never allow someone to be your priority while allowing yourself to be their option.
791.author: Mark Twain

792.quote: Realize that true happiness lies within you. Waste no time and effort searching for peace and contentment and joy in the world outside. Remember that there is no happiness in having or in getting, but only in giving. Reach out. Share. Smile. Hug. Happiness is a perfume you cannot pour on others without getting a few drops on yourself.
792.author: Og Mandino

793.quote: There is little difference in people, but that little difference makes a big difference. The little difference is attitude. The big difference is whether it is positive or negative.
793.author: W. Clement Stone

794.quote: Faithful servants never retire. You can retire from your career, but you will never retire from serving God.
794.author: Rick Warren

795.quote: The average dog is a nicer person than the average person.
795.author: Andy Rooney

796.quote: Dad needs to show an incredible amount of respect and humor and friendship toward his mate so the kids understand their parents are sexy, they're fun, they do things together, they're best friends. Kids learn by example. If I respect Mom, they're going to respect Mom.
796.author: Tim Allen

797.quote: We are United States Marines, and for two and a quarter centuries we have defined the standards of courage, esprit, and military prowess.
797.author: James L. Jones

798.quote: In matters of style, swim with the current; in matters of principle, stand like a rock.
798.author: Thomas Jefferson

799.quote: Patience is the companion of wisdom.
799.author: Saint Augustine

800.quote: The two hardest tests on the spiritual road are the patience to wait for the right moment and the courage not to be disappointed with what we encounter.
800.author: Paulo Coelho

801.quote: We can always choose to perceive things differently. You can focus on what's wrong in your life, or you can focus on what's right.
801.author: Marianne Williamson

802.quote: Self-worth comes from one thing - thinking that you are worthy.
802.author: Wayne Dyer

803.quote: Always seek out the seed of triumph in every adversity.
803.author: Og Mandino

805.quote: Learning is the beginning of wealth. Learning is the beginning of health. Learning is the beginning of spirituality. Searching and learning is where the miracle process all begins.
805.author: Jim Rohn

806.quote: You may have a fresh start any moment you choose, for this thing that we call 'failure' is not the falling down, but the staying down.
806.author: Mary Pickford

807.quote: Take it from a guy: If you're in love with somebody, you will swim the stream, you will climb the mountain, you will slay the dragon. You're going to get to her somehow, some way.
807.author: Phil McGraw

808.quote: Being entirely honest with oneself is a good exercise.
808.author: Sigmund Freud

809.quote: If you break your neck, if you have nothing to eat, if your house is on fire, then you got a problem. Everything else is inconvenience.
809.author: Robert Fulghum

810.quote: You can love someone so much...But you can never love people as much as you can miss them.
810.author: John Green

811.quote: Gratitude is riches. Complaint is poverty.
811.author: Doris Day

812.quote: Your attitude is like a box of crayons that color your world. Constantly color your picture gray, and your picture will always be bleak. Try adding some bright colors to the picture by including humor, and your picture begins to lighten up.
812.author: Allen Klein

813.quote: The revolution is not an apple that falls when it is ripe. You have to make it fall.
813.author: Che Guevara

814.quote: The best and most beautiful things in the world cannot be seen or even touched - they must be felt with the heart.
814.author: Helen Keller

815.quote: Miracles come in moments. Be ready and willing.
815.author: Wayne Dyer

816.quote: Stop acting as if life is a rehearsal. Live this day as if it were your last. The past is over and gone. The future is not guaranteed.
816.author: Wayne Dyer

817.quote: It's amazing what ordinary people can do if they set out without preconceived notions.
817.author: Ben Stein

818.quote: The harder the conflict, the more glorious the triumph.
818.author: Thomas Paine

819.quote: You teach best what you most need to learn.
819.author: Richard Bach

820.quote: All I have seen teaches me to trust the creator for all I have not seen.
820.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

821.quote: Peace cannot be kept by force; it can only be achieved by understanding.
821.author: Albert Einstein

822.quote: Either you run the day or the day runs you.
822.author: Jim Rohn

823.quote: Never forget the three powerful resources you always have available to you: love, prayer, and forgiveness.
823.author: H. Jackson Brown, Jr.

824.quote: I prefer to be true to myself, even at the hazard of incurring the ridicule of others, rather than to be false, and to incur my own abhorrence.
824.author: Frederick Douglass

825.quote: It is impossible for a man to learn what he thinks he already knows.
825.author: Epictetus

826.quote: My attitude is that if you push me towards something that you think is a weakness, then I will turn that perceived weakness into a strength.
826.author: Michael Jordan

827.quote: Without leaps of imagination, or dreaming, we lose the excitement of possibilities. Dreaming, after all, is a form of planning.
827.author: Gloria Steinem

828.quote: I have just returned from visiting the Marines at the front, and there is not a finer fighting organization in the world!
828.author: Douglas MacArthur

829.quote: The successful man will profit from his mistakes and try again in a different way.
829.author: Dale Carnegie

830.quote: Your family and your love must be cultivated like a garden. Time, effort, and imagination must be summoned constantly to keep any relationship flourishing and growing.
830.author: Jim Rohn

831.quote: Being ready is not what matters. What matters is winning after you get there.
831.author: Victor H. Krulak

832.quote: We should not judge people by their peak of excellence; but by the distance they have traveled from the point where they started.
832.author: Henry Ward Beecher

833.quote: One reason so few of us achieve what we truly want is that we never direct our focus; we never concentrate our power. Most people dabble their way through life, never deciding to master anything in particular.
833.author: Tony Robbins

834.quote: Our freedom can be measured by the number of things we can walk away from.
834.author: Vernon Howard

835.quote: We've all got both light and dark inside us. What matters is the part we choose to act on. That's who we really are.
835.author: J. K. Rowling

836.quote: Let my soul smile through my heart and my heart smile through my eyes, that I may scatter rich smiles in sad hearts.
836.author: Paramahansa Yogananda

837.quote: Learning is not attained by chance, it must be sought for with ardor and diligence.
837.author: Abigail Adams

838.quote: America will never be destroyed from the outside. If we falter and lose our freedoms, it will be because we destroyed ourselves.
838.author: Abraham Lincoln

839.quote: The highest form of worship is the worship of unselfish Christian service. The greatest form of praise is the sound of consecrated feet seeking out the lost and helpless.
839.author: Billy Graham

840.quote: Nothing I've ever done has given me more joys and rewards than being a father to my children.
840.author: Bill Cosby

841.quote: If you can learn to love yourself and all the flaws, you can love other people so much better. And that makes you so happy.
841.author: Kristin Chenoweth

842.quote: What is hell? I maintain that it is the suffering of being unable to love.
842.author: Fyodor Dostoevsky

843.quote: There is not one blade of grass, there is no color in this world that is not intended to make men rejoice.
843.author: John Calvin

844.quote: In the beginning of a change the patriot is a scarce man, and brave, and hated and scorned. When his cause succeeds, the timid join him, for then it costs nothing to be a patriot.
844.author: Mark Twain

845.quote: Stay away from what might have been, and look at what can be.
845.author: Marsha Petrie Sue

846.quote: One isn't necessarily born with courage, but one is born with potential. Without courage, we cannot practice any other virtue with consistency. We can't be kind, true, merciful, generous, or honest.
846.author: Maya Angelou

847.quote: Do not seek to follow in the footsteps of the wise. Seek what they sought.
847.author: Matsuo Basho

848.quote: Success is achieved by developing our strengths, not by eliminating our weaknesses.
848.author: Marilyn vos Savant

849.quote: There is only one corner of the universe you can be certain of improving, and that's your own self.
849.author: Aldous Huxley

850.quote: Failure is simply a few errors in judgment, repeated every day.
850.author: Jim Rohn

851.quote: We think too much and feel too little.
851.author: Charlie Chaplin

852.quote: Missions is not the ultimate goal of the church. Worship is. Missions exists because worship doesn't.
852.author: John Piper

853.quote: It's what you learn after you know it all that counts.
853.author: John Wooden

854.quote: In three words I can sum up everything I've learned about life: it goes on.
854.author: Robert Frost

855.quote: Maturity is the ability to think, speak and act your feelings within the bounds of dignity. The measure of your maturity is how spiritual you become during the midst of your frustrations.
855.author: Samuel Ullman

856.quote: Human beings can alter their lives by altering their attitudes of mind.
856.author: William James

857.quote: I pretended to be somebody I wanted to be until finally I became that person. Or he became me.
857.author: Cary Grant

858.quote: As we express our gratitude, we must never forget that the highest appreciation is not to utter words, but to live by them.
858.author: John F. Kennedy

859.quote: Do what you feel in your heart to be right - for you'll be criticized anyway. You'll be damned if you do, and damned if you don't.
859.author: Eleanor Roosevelt

860.quote: Great spirits have always encountered opposition from mediocre minds. The mediocre mind is incapable of understanding the man who refuses to bow blindly to conventional prejudices and chooses instead to express his opinions courageously and honestly.
860.author: Albert Einstein

861.quote: It is not until you become a mother that your judgment slowly turns to compassion and understanding.
861.author: Erma Bombeck

862.quote: The only way that I could figure they could improve upon Coca-Cola, one of life's most delightful elixirs, which studies prove will heal the sick and occasionally raise the dead, is to put bourbon in it.
862.author: Lewis Grizzard

863.quote: Searching and learning is where the miracle process all begins.
863.author: Jim Rohn

864.quote: You must make a decision that you are going to move on. It wont happen automatically. You will have to rise up and say, ‘I don’t care how hard this is, I don’t care how disappointed I am, I’m not going to let this get the best of me. I’m moving on with my life.
864.author: Joel Osteen

865.quote: These young guys are playing checkers. I'm out there playing chess.
865.author: Kobe Bryant

866.quote: If you don't stand for something you will fall for anything.
866.author: Malcolm X

867.quote: I firmly believe that any man's finest hour, the greatest fulfillment of all that he holds dear, is that moment when he has worked his heart out in a good cause and lies exhausted on the field of battle - victorious.
867.author: Vince Lombardi

868.quote: If we're growing, we're always going to be out of our comfort zone.
868.author: John C. Maxwell

869.quote: It doesn't matter which side of the fence you get off on sometimes. What matters most is getting off. You cannot make progress without making decisions.
869.author: Jim Rohn

870.quote: You just can't beat the person who never gives up.
870.author: Babe Ruth

871.quote: Common sense is the collection of prejudices acquired by age eighteen.
871.author: Albert Einstein

872.quote: Our attitude towards others determines their attitude towards us.
872.author: Earl Nightingale

873.quote: Out of suffering have emerged the strongest souls; the most massive characters are seared with scars.
873.author: Khalil Gibran

874.quote: Be nice to people on your way up because you'll meet them on your way down.
874.author: Wilson Mizner

875.quote: When I was 5 years old, my mother always told me that happiness was the key to life. When I went to school, they asked me what I wanted to be when I grew up. I wrote down ‘happy’. They told me I didn’t understand the assignment, and I told them they didn’t understand life.
875.author: John Lennon

876.quote: If we learn to open our hearts, anyone, including the people who drive us crazy, can be our teacher.
876.author: Pema Chodron

877.quote: There is some good in this world, and it's worth fighting for.
877.author: J. R. R. Tolkien

878.quote: Greed is a bottomless pit which exhausts the person in an endless effort to satisfy the need without ever reaching satisfaction.
878.author: Erich Fromm

879.quote: The happiness of your life depends upon the quality of your thoughts.
879.author: Marcus Aurelius

880.quote: Carpe diem! Rejoice while you are alive; enjoy the day; live life to the fullest; make the most of what you have. It is later than you think.
880.author: Horace

881.quote: Without a sense of urgency, desire loses its value.
881.author: Jim Rohn

882.quote: Whatever good things we build end up building us.
882.author: Jim Rohn

883.quote: You're mind is working at its best when you're being paranoid. You explore every avenue and possibility of your situation at high speed with total clarity.
883.author: Banksy

884.quote: The purpose of life is to live it, to taste experience to the utmost, to reach out eagerly and without fear for newer and richer experience.
884.author: Eleanor Roosevelt

885.quote: They're on our right, they're on our left, they're in front of us, they're behind us; they can't get away from us this time.
885.author: Chesty Puller

886.quote: I'm not in this world to live up to your expectations and you're not in this world to live up to mine.
886.author: Bruce Lee

887.quote: The major value in life is not what you get. The major value in life is what you become.
887.author: Jim Rohn

888.quote: The cost of freedom is always high, but Americans have always paid it. And one path we shall never choose, and that is the path of surrender, or submission.
888.author: John F. Kennedy

889.quote: We have to be careful in how we use this light shined on us.
889.author: Melinda Gates

890.quote: To solve any problem, here are three questions to ask yourself: First, what could I do? Second, what could I read? And third, who could I ask?
890.author: Jim Rohn

891.quote: I always wonder why birds choose to stay in the same place when they can fly anywhere on the earth, then I ask myself the same question.
891.author: Harun Yahya

892.quote: You've got to know your limitations. I don't know what your limitations are. I found out what mine were when I was twelve. I found out that there weren't too many limitations, if I did it my way.
892.author: Johnny Cash

893.quote: Give me six hours to chop down a tree and I will spend the first four sharpening the axe.
893.author: Abraham Lincoln

894.quote: If you really want to do something, you'll find a way. If you don't, you'll find an excuse.
894.author: Jim Rohn

895.quote: Be brave. Take risks. Nothing can substitute experience.
895.author: Paulo Coelho

896.quote: It is neither wealth nor splendor; but tranquility and occupation which give you happiness.
896.author: Thomas Jefferson

897.quote: A thousand words will not leave so deep an impression as one deed.
897.author: Henrik Ibsen

898.quote: Courage is the price that life exacts for granting peace.
898.author: Amelia Earhart

899.quote: The moment we begin to fear the opinions of others and hesitate to tell the truth that is in us, and from motives of policy are silent when we should speak, the divine floods of light and life no longer flow into our souls.
899.author: Elizabeth Cady Stanton

900.quote: To love means loving the unlovable. To forgive means pardoning the unpardonable. Faith means believing the unbelievable. Hope means hoping when everything seems hopeless.
900.author: Gilbert K. Chesterton

901.quote: Trust yourself, you know more than you think you do.
901.author: Benjamin Spock

902.quote: The worst evils which mankind has ever had to endure were inflicted by bad governments.
902.author: Ludwig von Mises

903.quote: Some people want it to happen, some wish it would happen, others make it happen.
903.author: Michael Jordan

904.quote: High achievement always takes place in the framework of high expectation.
904.author: Charles Kettering

905.quote: The body is your temple. Keep it pure and clean for the soul to reside in.
905.author: B.K.S. Iyengar

906.quote: Be like a duck. Calm on the surface, but always paddling like the dickens underneath.
906.author: Michael Caine

907.quote: Tears shed for self are tears of weakness, but tears shed for others are a sign of strength.
907.author: Billy Graham

908.quote: It is wise to direct your anger towards problems - not people; to focus your energies on answers - not excuses.
908.author: William Arthur Ward

909.quote: Success is neither magical nor mysterious. Success is the natural consequence of consistently applying the basic fundamentals.
909.author: Jim Rohn

910.quote: If we did all the things we are capable of doing, we would literally astound ourselves.
910.author: Thomas A. Edison

911.quote: As long as there's pasta and Chinese food in the world, I'm okay.
911.author: Michael Chang

912.quote: Love is our true destiny. We do not find the meaning of life by ourselves alone - we find it with another.
912.author: Thomas Merton

913.quote: The few who do are the envy of the many who only watch.
913.author: Jim Rohn

914.quote: I ask, sir, what is the militia? It is the whole people except for a few public officials.
914.author: George Mason

915.quote: Don't brood. Get on with living and loving. You don't have forever.
915.author: Leo Buscaglia

916.quote: The Marines have landed and the situation is well in hand.
916.author: Richard Harding Davis

917.quote: Life is one big road with lots of signs,
917.author: Bob Marley

918.quote: There is always some madness in love. But there is also always some reason in madness.
918.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

919.quote: For peace of mind, we need to resign as general manager of the universe.
919.author: Larry Eisenberg

920.quote: Only put off until tomorrow what you are willing to die having left undone.
920.author: Pablo Picasso

921.quote: I am free, no matter what rules surround me. If I find them tolerable, I tolerate them; if I find them too obnoxious, I break them. I am free because I know that I alone am morally responsible for everything I do.
921.author: Robert A. Heinlein

922.quote: Tricks and treachery are the practice of fools, that don't have brains enough to be honest.
922.author: Benjamin Franklin

923.quote: It's very hard in the beginning to understand that the whole idea is not to beat the other runners. Eventually you learn that the competition is against the little voice inside you that wants you to quit.
923.author: George A. Sheehan

924.quote: A well-developed sense of humor is the pole that adds balance to your steps as you walk the tightrope of life.
924.author: William Arthur Ward

925.quote: The will to win, the desire to succeed, the urge to reach your full potential... these are the keys that will unlock the door to personal excellence.
925.author: Confucius

926.quote: We relish news of our heroes, forgetting that we are extraordinary to somebody too.
926.author: Helen Hayes

927.quote: It isn't the mountain ahead that wears you out; it's the grain of sand in your shoe.
927.author: Robert W. Service

928.quote: Difficulties are meant to rouse, not discourage. The human spirit is to grow strong by conflict.
928.author: William Ellery Channing

929.quote: It takes less time to do a thing right, than it does to explain why you did it wrong.
929.author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

930.quote: The longer we dwell on our misfortunes, the greater is their power to harm us
930.author: Voltaire

931.quote: Sometimes I've believed as many as six impossible things before breakfast.
931.author: Lewis Carroll

932.quote: Do not fear mistakes. There are none.
932.author: Miles Davis

933.quote: Empty your mind, be formless. Shapeless, like water. If you put water into a cup, it becomes the cup. You put water into a bottle and it becomes the bottle. You put it in a teapot it becomes the teapot. Now, water can flow or it can crash. Be water, my friend.
933.author: Bruce Lee

934.quote: Expose yourself to your deepest fear; after that, fear has no power, and the fear of freedom shrinks and vanishes. You are free.
934.author: Jim Morrison

935.quote: Anger is an acid that can do more harm to the vessel in which it is stored than to anything on which it is poured.
935.author: Mark Twain

936.quote: Failure is success if we learn from it.
936.author: Malcolm Forbes

937.quote: You are here to enable the divine purpose of the Universe to unfold. That is how important you are!
937.author: Eckhart Tolle

938.quote: I still need Marines who can shoot and salute. But I need Marines who can fix jet engines and man sophisticated radar sets, as well.
938.author: Robert E. Cushman, Jr.

939.quote: People like us, who believe in physics, know that the distinction between past, present, and future is only a stubbornly persistent illusion.
939.author: Albert Einstein

940.quote: You can't expect to hit the jackpot if you don't put a few nickels in the machine.
940.author: Flip Wilson

941.quote: The only limit to our realization of tomorrow will be our doubts of today.
941.author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

942.quote: It is what we know already that often prevents us from learning.
942.author: Claude Bernard

943.quote: I've learned that making a 'living' is not the same thing as 'making a life'.
943.author: Maya Angelou

944.quote: The spirit, the will to win, and the will to excel are the things that endure. These qualities are so much more important than the events that occur.
944.author: Vince Lombardi

945.quote: What doesn't kill you makes you smaller
945.author: Mario

946.quote: When I started counting my blessings, my whole life turned around.
946.author: Willie Nelson

947.quote: The difficulties you meet will resolve themselves as you advance. Proceed, and light will dawn, and shine with increasing clearness on your path.
947.author: Jim Rohn

948.quote: Ninety-nine percent of the failures come from people who have the habit of making excuses.
948.author: George Washington Carver

949.quote: It's not what's happening to you now or what has happened in your past that determines who you become. Rather, it's your decisions about what to focus on, what things mean to you, and what you're going to do about them that will determine your ultimate destiny.
949.author: Tony Robbins

950.quote: Every time you smile at someone, it is an action of love, a gift to that person, a beautiful thing.
950.author: Mother Teresa

951.quote: Everything comes to us that belongs to us if we create the capacity to receive it.
951.author: Rabindranath Tagore

952.quote: Live your life and forget your age.
952.author: Norman Vincent Peale

953.quote: One of the penalties for refusing to participate in politics is that you end up being governed by your inferiors.
953.author: Plato

954.quote: We may not be able to prepare the future for our children, but we can at least prepare our children for the future.
954.author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

955.quote: That's been one of my mantras - focus and simplicity. Simple can be harder than complex: You have to work hard to get your thinking clean to make it simple. But it's worth it in the end because once you get there, you can move mountains.
955.author: Steve Jobs

956.quote: The trouble with most of us is that we would rather be ruined by praise than saved by criticism.
956.author: Norman Vincent Peale

957.quote: The smallest deed is better than the greatest intention.
957.author: John Burroughs

958.quote: Nothing else can quite substitute for a few well-chosen,
958.author: Sam Walton

959.quote: There is nothing in a caterpillar that tells you it's going to be a butterfly.
959.author: R. Buckminster Fuller

960.quote: A nation of sheep will beget a government of wolves.
960.author: Edward R. Murrow

961.quote: Only two things are infinite, the universe and human stupidity, and I'm not sure about the former.
961.author: Albert Einstein

962.quote: A charming woman... doesn't follow the crowd. She is herself.
962.author: Loretta Young

963.quote: You don't understand anything until you learn it more than one way.
963.author: Marvin Minsky

964.quote: Doubt yourself and you doubt everything you see. Judge yourself and you see judges everywhere. But if you listen to the sound of your own voice, you can rise above doubt and judgment. And you can see forever.
964.author: Nancy Lopez

965.quote: Find the good. It's all around you. Find it, showcase it and you'll start believing in it.
965.author: Jesse Owens

966.quote: Happiness in marriage is entirely a matter of chance.
966.author: Jane Austen

967.quote: The difference between a mountain and a molehill is your perspective.
967.author: Al Neuharth

968.quote: It is best to act with confidence, no matter how little right you have to it.
968.author: Lillian Hellman

969.quote: Men occasionally stumble over the truth, but most of them pick themselves up and hurry off as if nothing had happened.
969.author: Winston Churchill

970.quote: People usually consider walking on water or in thin air a miracle. But I think the real miracle is not to walk either on water or in thin air, but to walk on earth. Every day we are engaged in a miracle which we don't even recognize: a blue sky, white clouds, green leaves, the black, curious eyes of a child -- our own two eyes. All is a miracle.
970.author: Nhat Hanh

971.quote: Freedom means the opportunity to be what we never thought we would be.
971.author: Daniel J. Boorstin

972.quote: For it was not into my ear you whispered, but into my heart. It was not my lips you kissed, but my soul.
972.author: Judy Garland

973.quote: I will love the light for it shows me the way, yet I will endure the darkness because it shows me the stars.
973.author: Og Mandino

974.quote: If you run, you are a runner. It doesn't matter how fast or how far. It doesn't matter if today is your first day or if you've been running for twenty years. There is no test to pass, no license to earn, no membership card to get. You just run.
974.author: John Bingham

975.quote: The deepest principle in human nature is the craving to be appreciated.
975.author: William James

976.quote: About all you can do in life is be who you are. Some people will love you for you. Most will love you for what you can do for them, and some won't like you at all.
976.author: Rita Mae Brown

977.quote: To find out what one is fitted to do, and to secure an opportunity to do it, is the key to happiness.
977.author: John Dewey

978.quote: Forgiveness says you are given another chance to make a new beginning.
978.author: Desmond Tutu

979.quote: What is success? I think it is a mixture of having a flair for the thing that you are doing; knowing that it is not enough, that you have got to have hard work and a certain sense of purpose.
979.author: Margaret Thatcher

980.quote: The past has no power over the present moment.
980.author: Eckhart Tolle

981.quote: Do not let your fire go out, spark by irreplaceable spark in the hopeless swamps of the not-quite, the not-yet, and the not-at-all. Do not let the hero in your soul perish in lonely frustration for the life you deserved and have never been able to reach. The world you desire can be won. It exists.. it is real.. it is possible.. it's yours.
981.author: Ayn Rand

982.quote: No person was ever honored for what he received. Honor has been the reward for what he gave.
982.author: Calvin Coolidge

983.quote: Wherever you are, and whatever you do, be in love.
983.author: Rumi

984.quote: The world is a dangerous place to live; not because of the people who are evil, but because of the people who don't do anything about it.
984.author: Albert Einstein

985.quote: Love yourself-accept yourself-forgive yourself-and be good to yourself, because without you the rest of us are without a source of many wonderful things.
985.author: Leo Buscaglia

986.quote: I love things that age well - things that don't date, that stand the test of time and that become living examples of the absolute best.
986.author: Giorgio Armani

987.quote: The person, be it gentleman or lady, who has not pleasure in a good novel, must be intolerably stupid.
987.author: Jane Austen

988.quote: Better be wise by the misfortunes of others than by your own.
988.author: Aesop

989.quote: Whenever you find yourself on the side of the majority, it is time to pause and reflect.
989.author: Mark Twain

990.quote: And those who were seen dancing were thought to be insane by those who could not hear the music.
990.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

991.quote: Curiosity is one of the most permanent and certain characteristics of a vigorous intellect.
991.author: Samuel Johnson

992.quote: Leaders must be close enough to relate to others, but far enough ahead to motivate them.
992.author: John C. Maxwell

993.quote: Regret for the things we did can be tempered by time; it is regret for the things we did not do that is inconsolable.
993.author: Sydney J. Harris

994.quote: For every disciplined effort there is a multiple reward.
994.author: Jim Rohn

995.quote: The spiritual journey is individual, highly personal. It can't be organized or regulated. It isn't true that everyone should follow one path. Listen to your own truth.
995.author: Ram Dass

996.quote: No matter how plain a woman may be, if truth and honesty are written across her face, she will be beautiful.
996.author: Eleanor Roosevelt

997.quote: The mind is not a vessel to be filled but a fire to be kindled.
997.author: Plutarch

998.quote: America... just a nation of two hundred million used car salesmen with all the money we need to buy guns and no qualms about killing anybody else in the world who tries to make us uncomfortable.
998.author: Hunter S. Thompson

999.quote: Thousands have lived without love, not one without water.
999.author: W. H. Auden

1000.quote: The best way to keep one's word is not to give it.
1000.author: Napoleon Bonaparte
